newsitem.title: USA: Petro close to court OK on reverse merger.
newsitem.headline: Petro close to court OK on reverse merger.

text.p: A Petro Union Inc lawyer said Thursday a bankruptcy court approved the prerequisites for the company's proposed reverse merger with privately-held Horizontal Ventures Inc of Tulsa, Okla.
Petro, which filed for bankruptcy in May 1996 and is reorganizing itself, will acquire Horizontal for all its outstanding shares, said Petro's attorney Roger Davidson.

He said the reverse merger deal calls for the new company to have a net book value of more than $5 million and issue about one million class B shares, which will be traded on Nasdaq's national market.
Petro shareholders will receive 80,000 class B shares in the new company, Davidson said.
"Instead of wiping out shareholder value, they're getting essentially what they're having now," Davidson said. Petro's stock closed at 3/64 Wednesday.
Davidson said Petro's creditors will receive about 100,000 shares and Horizontal's shareholders about 780,000 shares, which gives them control of the new company.

Petro said in a statement it expects creditors and the bankruptcy court to approve the reorganization plan before September. It filed the plan with the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Indiana.
Oil and gas drilling firm Horizontal uses the same Amoco Corp drilling technology licensed to Petro, the statement said.
